title: Torque and work - compare work from torque graph

content.question: The graph shows the net torque exerted on a rigid system that is free to rotate around a fixed axis as a function of the angular displacement <math alttext="theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Î¸</mi></math>. Two trials are performed. In Trial <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math>, a constant net torque is applied to the system and in Trial <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> a varying net torque is applied to the system, as indicated in the graph. Which of the following correctly compares the work <math alttext="W sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub></math> done on the system in Trial <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> to the work <math alttext="W sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub></math> done on the system in Trial <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="W sub B is less than W sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math>
<math alttext="W sub B equals W sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math>

<math alttext="W sub B is greater than, open parenthesis, W sub A equals 0, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="W sub B is greater than W sub A, which is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></math>
